docs.lead_paragraph: Infectious diseases experts say the approach could work, but others see it as unrealistic in areas where access to contraception and abortions is limited.

headline.main: Growing Support Among Experts for Zika Advice to Delay Pregnancy
headline.print_headline: Delaying Pregnancy Until Zika Moves On

docs.abstract: Advice from health officials that women in countries affected by Zika virus delay pregnancy until outbreak is under control has been derided by many as unrealistic, particularly for poor women in country where abortion is illegal and contraception often unavailable; but some experts say delaying pregnancy long enough for population to build immunity may save newborns from disease's worst effects.
docs.snippet: Infectious diseases experts say the approach could work, but others see it as unrealistic in areas where access to contraception and abortions is limited.
